com.projecttango.unibw.graphmapper.floorplan

Class GraphmapperActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • com.projecttango.unibw.graphmapper.floorplan.GraphmapperActivity

  • public class GraphmapperActivity
extends Activity

    A small demo application that allows the user to create a navigation graph of indoor environments and a 2D floor plan of a building.

    The user can mark his point of interests (rooms, entrypoints, etc.) and connect hallways to build a hallway network of the building. This is called indoor navigation graph or network. As a result the user can save the adf with the navigation graph and load it in the next sessions. He can also draw the floor plan and save it as a jpg file. The big aim is to create a graph of an indoor environment that a indoor navigation system can use this graph as a map to navigate. The application can also be started in a viewer mode. After loading an existing adf and graph and relocalization in the area the user can view the floor plans and see his current position in it.

    The get wall measurements or POI measurements you have to click on the wall. After that there will be a plane fitting on the wall. The application uses TangoSupportLibrary to do plane fitting using the point cloud data. When the user clicks on the display, plane detection is done on the surface at the location of the click and a 3D object will be placed in the scene anchored at that location. A Wall Measurement will be recorded for that plane.

    You need to take exactly one measurement per wall in clockwise order. After you have taken all the measurements you can press the 'Done' button and the adf and graph will be saved and the final result can be drawn as a 2D floor plan along with labels showing the sizes of the walls and names of the POIs and hallways.

    Note that it is important to include the KEY_BOOLEAN_LOWLATENCYIMUINTEGRATION configuration parameter in order to achieve the best results synchronizing the Rajawali virtual world with the RGB camera.

    Added changes of Google's Okul update from June 9th (13.06.2016). This class is from the Java Floorlan example (https://github.com/googlesamples/tango-examples-java) and was edited by the author.

    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Konstantin Klinger

      • onTouch

        public boolean onTouch(View view,
              MotionEvent motionEvent)
        This method handles when the user clicks the screen. It will try to fit a plane to the clicked point using depth data.
        Parameters:
        view - (current view)
        motionEvent - (event that the user had done on the display)
        Returns:
        true (if there is no exception)

      • doWallMeasurement

        private WallMeasurement doWallMeasurement(float u,
                                float v,
                                double rgbTimestamp,
                                MeasurementType type)
        Use the TangoSupport library and point cloud data to calculate the plane at the specified location in the color camera frame.
        Parameters:
        u - (The u-coordinate for the user selection. This is expected to be between 0.0 and 1.0.)
        v - (The v-coordinate for the user selection. This is expected to be between 0.0 and 1.0.)
        rgbTimestamp - (timestamp of the current measurement)
        type - (type of the current measurement)
        Returns:
        new wallMeasurement object with the calculated pose or null if there wasn't a valid pose data

      • calculatePlaneTransform

        private float[] calculatePlaneTransform(double[] point,
                              double[] normal,
                              float[] openGlTdepth)
        Calculate the pose of the plane based on the position and normal orientation of the plane and align it with gravity.
        Parameters:
        point - (starting point of the plane)
        normal - (normal vector of the plane)
        openGlTdepth - (depth in openGL frame)
        Returns:
        pose of the plane in device frame

      • setLoadedADFPair

        public void setLoadedADFPair(ADFPair pair)
        This function checks if the adf loading process is finished yet. If true, it sets the the mLoadedADFPair value to the given pair and signals that the loading process is finished (mIsADFLoadingFinished).
        Parameters:
        pair - (uuid / name adf pair)

      • setViewer

        public void setViewer(boolean value)
        Setter function for the signal if the application is in recording or viewer state
        Parameters:
        value - (if true the application will be started in viewer state)

      • initViewer

        public void initViewer()
        This functions inits the view for re-localization before going into the viewer mode.

      • addHallway

        public void addHallway(java.lang.String hallwayName)
        This function creates a new hallway from the current measurements. It builds the hallway with all his rooms, markers, obstacles and entrypoints after upadating all measurements and stores it in the navigation graph structure. After that it removes from the renderer view all current measurements and clears all measurement lists. So the user can start to record a new hallway in the end.
        Parameters:
        hallwayName - (name of the current hallway to be finished)

      • addNewLevel

        public void addNewLevel(java.lang.String hallwayName)
        This function finishes the current hallway, clears all measurement list and objects and then starts the dialog to ask the user which level he want to record next.
        Parameters:
        hallwayName - (name of the current hallway to be finished)

      • resetHallway

        public void resetHallway()
        This function resets all current measurement list and objects of the current recording hallway. So the user can start from the beginning with recording the current hallway.

      • undoLastMeasurement

        public void undoLastMeasurement()
        This function eliminates the last taken measurement and removes the objects from the lists.

      • updateMeasurements

        public void updateMeasurements()
        Updates every saved measurement of the current hallway. It re-queries the device pose at the time the measurement was taken.

      • finishPlan

        public void finishPlan()
        Finish plan, save the adf, and show the final result. Executed as an AsyncTask because saving the adf could be an expensive operation.

      • canSaveAdf

        private boolean canSaveAdf()
        Verifies whether the Tango service is in a state where the ADF can be saved or not.
        Returns:
        returns a boolean value if the adf can be saved or not (true if yes)

      • matrixFromPointNormalUp

        private float[] matrixFromPointNormalUp(double[] point,
                              double[] normal,
                              float[] up)
        Calculates a transformation matrix based on a point, a normal and the up gravity vector. The coordinate frame of the target transformation will be Z forward, X left, Y up.
        Parameters:
        point - (starting point)
        normal - (normal vector)
        up - (up gravity vector)
        Returns:
        transformation matrix (Note the order: x, z, y)

      • normalize

        private void normalize(float[] v)
        Normalize a vector.
        Parameters:
        v - (un-normalized vector)

      • crossProduct

        private float[] crossProduct(float[] v1,
                   float[] v2)
        Cross product between two vectors following the right hand rule.
        Parameters:
        v1 - (first vector)
        v2 - (second vector)
        Returns:
        cross product

      • saveGraph

        public void saveGraph()
        This function saves the current navigation graph (network) as a text file on the device in GSON format.

      • loadGraph

        private boolean loadGraph(java.lang.String name)
        This function loads a prerecorded graph from a textfile in GSON format.
        Parameters:
        name - (name of the graph to be loaded)
        Returns:
        (true if the loading process was successful, false if not)

      • drawLevelOnCanvas

        public GraphmapperActivity.PlanView drawLevelOnCanvas(int level,
                                             float[] position,
                                             float[] orientation)
        This function builds a PlanView object of the 2D plan from a recorded level.
        Parameters:
        level - (level of the building to be drawn)
        position - (current position of the user or null if not used / drawn)
        orientation - (current orientation of the user or null if not used / drawn)
        Returns:
        PlanView object with the current view to be drawn

      • drawHallwayOnCanvas

        public GraphmapperActivity.PlanView drawHallwayOnCanvas(Hallway hallway,
                                               float[] position,
                                               float[] orientation)
        This function build a PlanView object of the 2D plan from a recorded hallway (zoom into hallways).
        Parameters:
        hallway - (hallway to be zoomed in)
        position - (current position of the user or null if not used / drawn)
        orientation - (current orientation of the user or null if not used / drawn)
        Returns:
        PlanView object with the current view to be drawn
